meanings.definition: A person who is annoying or irritating.
meanings.sent1: The nudnick kept talking loudly during the movie.
meanings.sent2: My little brother can be a nudnick when he doesn't get his way.
meanings.sent3: The nudnick at the party wouldn't stop telling the same boring story.
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaints made her the nudnick of the office.
meanings.sent5: The persistent nudnick in class always interrupts the teacher.

meanings.sent1: Please don't nudnick me with your constant questions.
meanings.sent2: The buzzing mosquito continued to nudnick me all night.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy nudnicked the cat by chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet can nudnick anyone trying to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the clock ticking can nudnick some people.
